meanings.definition: Speak with sudden involuntary pauses and a tendency to repeat the initial letters of words.
meanings.sent1: He stammers when he gets nervous and struggles to speak smoothly.
meanings.sent2: She stammers when she is excited and finds it hard to express herself clearly.
meanings.sent3: The comedian pretended to stammer during his act, making the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: His heart stammers with fear as he approaches the edge of the cliff.
meanings.sent5: The old engine stammers to life, sputtering and coughing before finally starting.

meanings.definition: Make involuntary pauses before or during speech.
meanings.sent1: The shy student stammers before answering questions in class.
meanings.sent2: During the interview, she stammers a bit before regaining her composure.
meanings.sent3: The robot seemed to stammer as it processed the complex command given to it.
meanings.sent4: The music stammers briefly before flowing smoothly into the next melody.
meanings.sent5: The wind stammers through the leaves, creating a soothing rustling sound.
